page.title: 19EDUCATION
page.content: Wreckers struck at a school within hours of the start of the summer holiday at the weekend. At Culverhouse School,South Ockendon,a small casement window was forced,and a fire started in a store cupboard.Paper and cards in the cupboard were destroyed,but the fire was contained,though several rooms were smoke damaged. A spokesman for Essex County Council said this week"These incidents,and there are more and more every year,cost millions of pounds that could be otherwise spent on more valuable aspects of education. "At a cost of Â£5O,OOO this year,we are improving security in schools by installing intruder alarms.
